Class GradingAssist

java.lang.Object
GradingAssist
public class GradingAssist
extends java.lang.Object

This program is meant for University graders using the Moodle website to intake assignment solutions which have
grader-generated feedback files, unlike overwriting submission files.

This program works by generating lists for feedback folders and files, matching these to each other, and subsequently
placing the right files into the right folders. By hand, this task usually takes around 15 minutes to complete. With
this program, it's ~20ms. Yes, milliseconds.

Special thanks:
Apache Commons for creating FileUtils

WARNING: DEVELOPED FOR NON-COMMERCIAL USE ONLY. CHECK LICENSE FILE FOR MORE DETAILS ON USAGE RIGHTS.

Author:
Aaron Shaw

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      calls two subsequent methods that accomplish different tasks:
      task A: generate empty folders from the submissions directory
      task B: filling the generated folders with the correctly matched feedback files

      Parameters:
      args - default parameter

    • generateEmptyFolders

      public static java.lang.String generateEmptyFolders()

      reads folder names from the submissions folder, then generates empty folders with the SAME names in a new directory - without their contained submissions files

      Returns:
      full file path of a generated text file containing names of every folder in the submissions folder

    • makeDestinationParentFolder

      public static void makeDestinationParentFolder​(java.lang.String folderPath, java.lang.String folderName)

      creates the empty directory parallel to the submissions folder that will contain the generated empty feedback folders

      Parameters:
      folderPath - full path of the folder right before the submissions folder
      folderName - name of the folder to be created

    • makeDestinationFolders

      public static void makeDestinationFolders​(java.io.File folderNameSource, java.lang.String destinationFolderPath)

      creates the empty feedback folders

      Parameters:
      folderNameSource - the file containing the names of the folders to be generated
      destinationFolderPath - the path of the directory that will contain the generated feedback folders

    • generateFile

      public static java.io.File generateFile​(java.lang.String filePath, java.lang.String fileName)

      creates a file containing the names of every single file/folder in the folder specified, in the folder
      specified - wrap your head around that one :D

      Parameters:
      filePath - the path of the directory whose file/folder names are to be read and documented
      fileName - the name of the file in which names of all the files in the folder will be documented
      Returns:
      the file containing the names of all the files in the folder, and yes, this file shall include it's own name - you needn't worry

    • getFolderPath

      public static java.lang.String getFolderPath​(java.lang.String descriptor)

      interacts with you :D to get the path to a specified folder

      Parameters:
      descriptor - the description of the specified folder
      Returns:
      the path of the folder you entered

    • validateFolderPath

      public static boolean validateFolderPath​(java.lang.String folderPath)

      validates the folder path you entered for you :D - folder path is invalid if it contains any of the following characters: < > : " / | ? *

      Parameters:
      folderPath - the path to validate
      Returns:
      true if path is valid, false otherwise

    • fillFeedbackFolders

      public static void fillFeedbackFolders​(java.lang.String submissionsFolderPath)

      fills created empty feedback folders with correctly matched files

      Parameters:
      submissionsFolderPath - the full path to the submissions folder including the drive label and the folder name "submissions"

    • readFolderNames

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readFolderNames​(java.io.File folderNamesFile)

      creates an ArrayList with all feedback folder names read from a file

      Parameters:
      folderNamesFile - the file containing the names of all submission folders
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the names of every feedback folder to be filled

    • convertFoldersForMatching

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>[] convertFoldersForMatching​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> foldersToFill)

      converts the feedback folder names into delimited ArrayLists for convenient matching

      Parameters:
      foldersToFill - the ArrayList containing the names of the feedback folders as solid Strings
      Returns:
      an array of ArrayLists containing delimited(separated) feedback folder names

    • readFileNames

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> readFileNames​(java.io.File fileNamesFile)

      creates an ArrayList with all feedback file names read from a file

      Parameters:
      fileNamesFile - the file containing the names of all feedback files
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the names of every feedback file

    • convertFilesForMatching

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>[] convertFilesForMatching​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> filesToMove)

      converts the feedback file names into delimited ArrayLists for convenient matching

      Parameters:
      filesToMove - the ArrayList containing the names of the feedback files as solid Strings
      Returns:
      an array of ArrayLists containing delimited(separated) feedback file names

    • initializeMatches

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> initializeMatches​(boolean[] filesMoved)

      initializes the list of unmatched feedback files - this is speed

      Parameters:
      filesMoved - information on which feedback files have been matched and moved
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing the index numbers of every unmatched feedback file

    • moveFile

      public static void moveFile​(java.lang.String fileName, java.lang.String folderName, java.lang.String feedbackFolderPath, java.lang.String submissionsFolderPath)

      moves a feedback file into its corresponding feedback folder once they have been matched

      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the feedback file to move
      folderName - the name of the feedback folder to which the file will be moved
      feedbackFolderPath - the path of the created empty feedback folders
      submissionsFolderPath - the path of the original submissions folder

    • filter

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> filter​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>[] fileNames, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> matches, java.lang.String folderName)

      filters matches using feedback file and folder names

      Parameters:
      fileNames - the delimited names of all the feedback files
      matches - the array of currently active matches
      folderName - a part of the name of the folder for which matches are being found
      Returns:
      the list of corresponding matches
